title: Is Mali about to fall to al-Qaeda affiliate JNIM?
summary: The al-Qaeda-linked group has imposed an economic siege on Bamako since September.

title: Trump says New Yorkers will flee city under ‘communist’ mayor Mamdani
summary: US President Donald Trump labelled New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani ‘a communist’.

title: Germany offers vulnerable Afghans cash to cease immigration efforts
summary: Some 2,000 Afghans were approved for relocation to Germany under scheme for people who worked with German forces.

title: Afghan earthquake survivors face winter cold after deadly quakes
summary: Villagers in Kunar province brace for harsh winter without proper shelter or clothing following devastating earthquakes.

title: North Korea accuses US of ‘wicked’ hostility over cybercrime sanctions
summary: US Treasury accuses Pyongyang of stealing $3bn in digital assets for its nuclear weapons programme over three years.

title: Lakers, Doncic win fifth straight, defeat Spurs without Reaves, James
summary: LA Lakers, playing without injured Austin Reaves and LeBron James, move to 7-2 on the season after San Antonio victory.

title: LIVE: Israel kills more Palestinians in Gaza as US peace plan given to UN
summary: Attacks continue in Bureij refugee camp in central Gaza as Israeli forces expand military action beyond 'yellow line'.

title: Japan deploys the military in north to battle surge in bear attacks
summary: At least 12 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in bear attacks across Japan since April.

title: How the UPS cargo plane crashed in Louisville, what we know about victims
summary: Officials confirmed that at least 12 people died. Kentucky’s governor warned that the death toll is expected to rise.

title: China’s emissions to peak later than previously forecast, experts say
summary: Seven in 10 climate researchers expect China's carbon emissions to peak by the end of the decade, survey shows.

title: Typhoon Kalmaegi bears down on Vietnam after 114 killed in the Philippines
summary: Meteorologists have warned that the typhoon has regained strength as it barrels towards Vietnam's central regions.

title: Man City’s Foden scores two goals in win over Dortmund in Champions League
summary: Phil Foden's dazzling double against Borussia Dortmund kept Manchester City unbeaten in UEFA Champions League.

title: Gaza : Israël annonce qu'un nouveau corps d'otage a été restitué par le Hamas
summary: Israël a annoncé mercredi soir qu'une nouvelle dépouille d'otage avait été remise par le Hamas à son armée, par l'intermédiaire de la Croix-Rouge. Cette restitution porte à 22 le nombre d'otages morts rendus par le mouvement islamiste palestinien, sur un total de 28.

title: Gaza : la nouvelle dépouille d'otage rendue par le Hamas identifiée comme celle du soldat Itay Chen
summary: Selon le bureau du Premier ministre israélien Benjamin Netanyahu, Israël a reçu mardi soir une nouvelle dépouille d'otage retenu à Gaza, remise plus tôt par le Hamas à la Croix-Rouge. La dépouille a été identifiée comme étant celle du soldat israélo-américain Itay Chen, enlevé le 7 octobre 2023.

title: Israël : une ex-procureure arrêtée pour la fuite d'une vidéo de sévices sur des détenus palestiniens
summary: L'ex-procureure générale de l'armée israélienne a été arrêtée, dans la nuit de dimanche à lundi, dans le cadre d'une enquête concernant la fuite d'une vidéo en 2024, qui suggère de graves sévices à l'encontre d'un détenu palestinien dans une prison de haute sécurité près de Gaza. Cinq soldats réservistes ont été inculpés dans cette affaire.

title: En Cisjordanie occupée, ces villages "laboratoires de l'annexion rampante" israélienne
summary: À la Une de la presse lundi : direction la Cisjordanie occupée où les autorités israéliennes imposent désormais un "permis de résidence" aux habitants de certains villages ; une enquête de la presse britannique sur l'exploitation sexuelle des centaines de milliers de Colombiennes et la nouvelle passion de plus en plus de joueurs de NBA : les échecs.

title: Les trois corps rendus par le Hamas à Israël identifiés comme ceux d'otages
summary: Les autorités israéliennes ont annoncé, lundi, avoir identifié les trois dernières dépouilles rendues par le Hamas comme étant celles de soldats enlevés le 7 octobre 2023. Cela porte à 20 le nombre d'otages morts restitués par le mouvement islamiste palestinien sur un total de 28. Par ailleurs, l'État hébreu a rendu 45 corps de Palestiniens.

title: Gaza : Israël annonce avoir reçu trois dépouilles d'otages
summary: Trois dépouilles d'otages enlevés par le Hamas le 7 octobre 2023 ont été remises dimanche à la Croix-Rouge dans la bande de Gaza avant d'être transférées à l'armée israélienne, selon le bureau du Premier ministre israélien. Ils doivent encore être identifiés par l'Institut national de médecine légale.

title: Israël menace d'intensifier ses attaques contre le Hezbollah dans le sud du Liban
summary: Au lendemain d'un raid meurtrier contre des membres du Hezbollah au Liban, le gouvernement israélien a menacé, dimanche, d'intensifier ses attaques. Le Premier ministre Benjamin Netanyahu l'accuse de se "réarmer" et exhorte le Hezbollah à respecter ses engagements de désarmement, avertissant qu'Israël se réserve le "droit à l'autodéfense".

title: Les trois corps remis par le Hamas ne sont pas ceux d'otages, selon Israël
summary: L'armée israélienne affirme que les trois corps remis à Israël par le Hamas vendredi soir ne sont pas ceux d'otages enlevés le 7 octobre 2023. Le mouvement islamiste palestinien a jusqu'à présent restitué les restes de 17 des 28 corps qui se trouvaient encore à Gaza au moment de l'entrée en vigueur de l'accord de cessez-le feu voilà trois semaines.

title: Gaza : Israël a rendu les corps de 30 Palestiniens en échange de deux dépouilles d'otages
summary: Une trentaine de corps de prisonniers palestiniens ont été rendus vendredi par Israël en échange de deux dépouilles d'otages israéliens qui avaient été restituées la veille. Le Hamas a jusqu'à présent restitué les restes de 17 des 28 corps qui se trouvaient encore à Gaza au moment de l'entrée en vigueur de l'accord de cessez-le feu voilà trois semaines.

title: Depuis la guerre de 12 jours avec Israël, une répression accrue est observée en Iran
summary: Une Mission indépendante de l'ONU s'inquiète, jeudi, d'une hausse de la répression en Iran consécutive aux frappes israéliennes de juin, alertant sur le sort des personnes arrêtées, notamment des journalistes et des minorités, lors de la guerre. "Un regain qui reflète une tendance récurrente", déplore la présidente de la mission.

title: Les juifs ultra-orthodoxes massivement mobilisés à Jérusalem contre la conscription
summary: À l'appel des partis ultra-orthodoxes Judaïsme unifié de la Torah et Shass, des dizaines de milliers de manifestants se sont rassemblés, jeudi, à Jérusalem pour réclamer le rétablissement d'un arrangement qui exemptait du service militaire les étudiants des écoles talmudiques, avant son invalidation par la Cour suprême israélienne.

title: Gaza : l'armée israélienne a récupéré et identifié les corps de deux otages
summary: Israël a identifié les restes des otages Amiram Kuper et Sahar Baruch, dont les corps ont été rendus par le Hamas plus tôt dans la journée. Le Hamas palestinien avait déjà remis les restes de 15 des 28 corps qui auraient dû être rendus au début de la trêve.

title: Stéphanie Latte Abdallah, historienne : « Le plan “de paix” de Trump a imposé une vision du futur de Gaza fondée sur la logique coloniale »
summary: La spécialiste du Moyen-Orient déplore que le projet du président américain pour la bande de Gaza vienne consacrer l’effacement politique des Palestiniens. Pour elle, un « accélérationnisme économique » est venu se substituer au droit international.

title: En Hongrie, Viktor Orban utilise l’intelligence artificielle pour décrédibiliser son opposant
summary: A l’approche des législatives d’avril 2026, des vidéos créées par IA montrent Péter Magyar, principal opposant au premier ministre hongrois, annoncer une baisse des retraites, enfermé dans une camisole de force ou traîné comme un chien en laisse.

title: Elon Musk : les actionnaires de Tesla se penchent sur la rémunération de 1 000 milliards de dollars promise au dirigeant
summary: Ses partisans espèrent qu’Elon Musk, qualifié de « visionnaire », reste aux manettes de Tesla avec une telle rémunération. Mais le débat est loin d’être clos alors que se tient jeudi l’assemblée générale des actionnaires.

title: « La Russie raconte des histoires atroces sur l’Ukraine dans les territoires occupés, et cela fonctionne »
summary: Dina Urich, de l’ONG Plakhta, explique, dans un entretien au « Monde », combien sortir de ces zones sous contrôle russe est difficile, long, coûteux, et décrit l’impact de la propagande russe sur les habitants à leur sortie.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : un mort dans une attaque de drones à Volgograd, en Russie
summary: Un peu plus tôt dans la journée, le ministère de la défense russe a déclaré que ses forces avançaient à l’intérieur de Pokrovsk, point central des combats dans l’est de l’Ukraine, et que l’offensive se poursuivait en direction du nord de la ville. Selon le groupe d’analyse DeepState, « la situation reste critique ».

title: Les conditions d’accueil des migrants à Montgenèvre jugées « indignes » par le Contrôleur général des lieux de privation de liberté
summary: Le CGLPL dénonce des « dysfonctionnements graves » dans le traitement des migrants par la police à la frontière franco-italienne, ainsi qu’un manque de personnel.

title: « C’est comme s’ils sortaient d’une secte » : l’Ukraine face à l’endoctrinement de ses enfants rapatriés de Russie et des territoires occupés
summary: A ce jour, 1 762 enfants ukrainiens ont été rapatriés après leur transfert forcé par Moscou. Les Ukrainiens s’efforcent de les désendoctriner et alertent sur le fait qu’aujourd’hui tous les enfants vivant sous occupation, russifiés et militarisés, sont arrachés à leur pays sans même avoir à être déportés physiquement.

title: « De la Chine ou des Etats-Unis, qui assurera sa domination, stratégique et économique, sur le siècle en cours ? »
summary: Si la rencontre entre Donald Trump et Xi Jinping, jeudi 30 octobre, a marqué une trêve apparente entre les deux puissances, elle confirme également la singularité de la relation sino-américaine, faite de rivalité et de concurrence globale, estime dans sa chronique Alain Frachon, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Aux Etats-Unis, le résultat des scrutins locaux, de la Californie à New York, redonne de l’air aux démocrates
summary: Si les succès de mardi ne résolvent pas les problèmes de fond du parti, ils lui permettent de sortir du marasme qui a suivi la défaite à la présidentielle, et lui donnent des pistes pour reconstruire son projet, à un an des élections de mi-mandat.

title: Dans le nord-est de la Syrie, le retour en force de l’organisation Etat islamique
summary: Dans la région de Deir ez-Zor, les djihadistes multiplient les attaques armées contre les forces kurdes. L’organisation au drapeau noir profite notamment du désengagement progressif des forces américaines.

title: « Le Bateau de marbre blanc », de Mikhaïl Chichkine : un vade-mecum du rebelle russe
summary: Avec ce recueil d’essais, l’écrivain en exil invite à reconsidérer les grands auteurs et artistes de Russie en flambeaux de la résistance à Poutine.

title: Droits de douane : devant la Cour suprême, les contradictions de l’administration Trump
summary: Les juges, devant lesquels la légalité des tarifs imposés par le président américain était contestée, se sont montrés critiques envers l’avocat général, qui défendait les prérogatives de l’exécutif.

title: Israeli defence minsters tells army to turn border with Egypt into closed military zone
summary:
Israeli defence minsters tells army to turn border with Egypt into closed military zone

Israeli defence minister Yisrael Katz on Thursday instructed the army to turn the border area between Israel and Egypt into a closed military zone, news channel Israel Hayom reported. 

The report said that Katz agrees with the head of the Shin Bet to treat arms smuggling via marches as "a terrorist threat".

title: Illegal Israeli settlers fence off over 200 hectares of Palestinian land in West Bank
summary:
Illegal Israeli settlers fence off over 200 hectares of Palestinian land in West Bank

Israeli settlers on Thursday fenced off about 202 hectares (500 acres) of Palestinian-owned agricultural land in the Khirbet Samra area of the occupied West Bank, Palestinian news agency Wafa reported. 

Wafa said fencing off the land marks an initial step towards seizing it.

Israel’s Yedioth Ahronoth newspaper has reported that Benjamin Netanyahu’s government has built or approved around 48,000 settlement housing units since taking office, a figure expected to rise to 50,000.

The figures expose the regime’s relentless expansion of illegal settlements across the occupied West Bank, deepening the theft of Palestinian land in defiance of international law and repeated global condemnation.

title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian boy in West Bank's Jenin
summary:
Israeli forces kill Palestinian boy in West Bank's Jenin

Israeli forces on Thursday shot and killed a 15-year-old boy, Murad Fawzi Abu Seifen, in the town of Yamoun, near the West Bank city of Jenin, the Palestinian health ministry said.

Palestinian news agency Wafa reported that the town was raided by Israeli forces overnight, during which they fired at Seifen and killed him.

title: WHO to rebuild 20 Gaza health facilities damaged in Israeli assault
summary:
WHO to rebuild 20 Gaza health facilities damaged in Israeli assault

The World Health Organisation (WHO) chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Thursday said the UN agency will rebuild and renovate 20 health facilities across Gaza destroyed or damaged by Israel's assault. 

Ghebreyesus said the effort will take place in partnership with the UN children’s agency Unicef and the agency for Palestinian refugees, Unrwa.

The agencies will provide “routine vaccinations, nutrition screening and treatment, and growth monitoring” for an estimated 44,000 children.

title: Israeli court approves demolition of family home of jailed Palestinian man
summary:
Israeli court approves demolition of family home of jailed Palestinian man

Israel's High Court of Justice on Wednesday ruled to allow the partial demolition of the family home of Palestinian man Abed al-Karim Snober, news organisation Haaretz reported. 

Israel accuses Snober of planting explosive devices in three buses in Bat Yam and Holon, south of Tel Aviv. 

The report said that two Supreme Court justices backed the majority opinion, Ofer Grosskopf and Alex Stein, with one justice, Daphne Barak-Erez objecting in the minority opinion.

The petition was filed against the decision of the military commander to demolish Snober's home in the town of Zawata, near Nablus in the West Bank.

title: YouTube removes videos documenting Israel's violation of international law
summary:
YouTube removes videos documenting Israel's violation of international law

YouTube has removed hundreds of videos from three prominent Palestinian human rights organisations that documented Israel's violations of international law, The Intercept reported on Tuesday.

More than 700 videos were deleted, along with the accounts of Al-Haq, Al Mezan Centre for Human Rights, and the Palestinian Centre.

All three groups reportedly had hours of footage documenting Israel’s violations of international law in Gaza and the occupied West Bank, reportedly including the killing of Palestinian civilians.

 
 
 
 
View this post on Instagram
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 

A post shared by Middle East Eye (@middleeasteye)

title: Israel arrested 540 Palestinians from West Bank and Jerusalem in October, officials say
summary:
Israel arrested 540 Palestinians from West Bank and Jerusalem in October, officials say

Israeli forces arrested 540 Palestinians in the occupied West Bank and Jerusalem during the month of October, including 8 women and 39 children, the Palestinian Prisoners' Media Office said on Thursday. 

The office said that the total number of detainees from October 2023 exceeded 19,300, including 600 women and 1,540 children. 

Palestinian prisoners' rights groups reported that over 9,250 Palestinians are being held in Israeli custody currently. The organisations said that the majority are administrative detainees held without trial, adding that the figure does not include detainees held in Israeli military camps.

They also reported that 1,242 of those held are sentenced prisoners, 49 are women and 350 are children.

title: Israeli assault left 288,000 Palestinian families homeless, officials say
summary:
Israeli assault left 288,000 Palestinian families homeless, officials say

Gaza's Government Media Office on Thursday said that an estimated 268,000 houses have been destroyed by the Israeli assault and that 288,000 Palestinian families have been left homeless, causing a "severe housing crisis". 

Unrwa says nearly the entire population of Gaza has been displaced, with many families returning home after the ceasefire only to find their neighbourhoods reduced to rubble.

Using satellite analysis from the UN Satellite Centre, Unrwa said around 81 percent of all structures in Gaza have been damaged or destroyed, a reflection of the devastation caused by Israel’s assault.

Israeli bombardments have levelled homes, hospitals and water networks, leaving Gaza’s infrastructure in ruins. Despite the ceasefire, Israel continues to strangle the enclave, keeping crossings closed and blocking essential aid and reconstruction materials from entering.

According to the Gaza health ministry, the Israeli genocidal war has killed over 68,875 Palestinians since October 2023. Another 10,000 are missing, presumed dead.

Israel has committed more than 200 violations of the ceasefire agreement that came into effect on 10 October, the director of the government media office in Gaza said.

title: US shares draft resolution on Gaza with UN Security Council
summary:
US shares draft resolution on Gaza with UN Security Council

The US officially shared the draft resolution on Gaza with the UN Security Council on Thursday, Al Jazeera Arabic reported, citing diplomatic sources. 

The report said that the resolution calls for the formation of a temporary international force in Gaza, which would work with Israel and Egypt, in addition to the establishment of a reconstruction fund by the World Bank.

The draft resolution also mentions the establishment of a Peace Council as a transitional body for reconstruction and aid management.

The US Ambassador to the United Nations met with elected Security Council members to discuss the draft. The meeting also included representatives from Egypt, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Turkey, and the United Arab Emirates.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning Middle East Eye readers,

Here are the latest updates from Gaza and the region, 26 days after a fragile ceasefire between Israel and Hamas:

  • US has officially distributed the draft resolution on Gaza to the UN Security Council. The document calls for a transitional body for reconstruction and aid management in addition to a "temporary international stabilisation force" that would work with Israel.

  • Israeli forces have arrested 540 citizens in the occupied West Bank and Jerusalem during October, including 8 women and 39 children, according to the Palestinian Prisoners' Media Office. 

  • World Health Organisation, which is set to begin its immunisation campaign in Gaza next week, has stressed the need to maintain the ceasefire.

  • Approximately 268,000 housing units were destroyed by Israeli forces and 288,000 Palestinian families have been left homeless, Gaza's Government Media Office has reported. 

  •  The Israeli army, in renewed violations in Gaza, has demolished several residential buildings east of Gaza City.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until Wednesday morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • At least 68,875 people have been killed and 170,679 wounded by Israeli attacks across Gaza since October 2023, the Palestinian health ministry said in a statement on social media on Wednesday.

  • Israel has handed over the bodies of 15 Palestinians, the day after Hamas returned the body of an Israeli-American soldier, according to Al Jazeera, citing health officials at Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis.

  • Gaza’s health ministry says the bodies handed over by Israel under the ceasefire deal were so badly mutilated they could barely be identified.

  • Israeli forces and settlers carried out 2,350 attacks across the occupied West Bank last month, Wafa news agency reported, citing the Palestinian Authority’s Colonisation and Wall Resistance Commission.

  • The Hind Rajab Foundation (HRF) says its complaint accusing the European Investment Bank (EIB) of complicity in Israeli war crimes has moved to a formal assessment phase within the bank’s complaints mechanism.

  • More than 26,000 people in the United Kingdom have signed a petition calling for the cancellation of Thursday’s football match between British club Aston Villa and Israel’s Maccabi Tel Aviv.

  • Since the ceasefire took effect on 10 October, Israeli authorities have rejected 23 requests from nine aid agencies to bring in essential shelter materials, such as tents, sealing kits, and blankets, nearly 4,000 pallets in total, to displaced Palestinians in Gaza, the Norwegian Refugee Council (NRC) said.

  • Over 9,250 Palestinian prisoners and detainees are being held in Israeli custody as of November, Palestinian prisoners' rights groups are reporting.

  • The United States is set to circulate a draft resolution outlining President Donald Trump’s proposed Gaza peace plan to the ten elected members of the UN Security Council later today, Reuters reported, citing a US official.

title: Italian journalist fired after asking if Israel should rebuild Gaza
summary:
Italian journalist fired after asking if Israel should rebuild Gaza

An Italian journalist has been dismissed after asking a European Commission official whether Israel should pay for rebuilding Gaza following its devastation of the enclave.

Gabriele Nunziati, a Brussels-based correspondent for Rome’s Nova news agency, told The Intercept he was informed via email that his collaboration with the outlet would end, barely a month after starting his post.

The decision, first reported by Italy’s Fanpage website, came shortly after Nunziati questioned Paula Pinho, the European Commission’s chief spokesperson, at an October 13 press briefing.

“You’ve been repeating several times that Russia should pay for the reconstruction of Ukraine,” Nunziati said. “Do you believe that Israel should pay for the reconstruction of Gaza since they have destroyed almost all its civilian infrastructure?”

His dismissal has sparked criticism over media censorship and the growing intolerance towards journalists who challenge western double standards on Israel’s destruction of Gaza.

summary: Tehran, IRNA - Iran has sympathized with the people and governments of the Philippines and Indonesia over recent floods, which claimed dozens of lives and caused extensive damage in the two East Asian countries.

summary: Islamabad, IRNA – Parliament Speaker Mohammad Baqer Qalibaf said his visit to Pakistan provides an opportunity to expand relations between the two neighboring countries, especially on regional cooperation.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and his Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, discussed the current state of bilateral relations and regional and international developments.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Shina Ansari, Iran’s Vice President and Head of the Department of Environment, has traveled to Brazil to participate in the 30th United Nations Climate Change Conference, known as COP30.

summary: Tehran, IRNA – Lebanese politician Hekmat Amhaz has said that Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has set “strict conditions” for the United States in any future negotiations, noting that Iran acts from a position of power.

title: Withdrawing from NPT requires careful expert evaluation
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 06 (MNA) – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi says that withdrawing from NPT requires careful expert evaluation, and Iran's current decision is to remain a committed NPT member.

title: Tehran Peace Museum honors two national heroes
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 06 (MNA) – The thirteenth edition of the People's Awards for Unknown Heroes, held in memory of Martyr Darya Gholi Sourani, took place at the Tehran Peace Museum this week.

title: Iran, Russia, China hold trilateral nuclear consultations
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 06 (MNA) – Russia's permanent representative to the Vienna-based International Organizations, Mikhail Ulyanov, announced that Tehran, Moscow, and Beijing have held a trilateral consultative meeting regarding Iran’s nuclear issue.

title: Pezeshkian in Kordestan for project inauguration
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 06 (MNA) – Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian arrived in Sanandaj on Thursday morning for a one-day trip to Kordrstan Province, where he will inaugurate several development projects.

title: Front pages of Iran's English dailies on November 6
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 06 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Thursday, November 6.

title: Tehran, Riyadh ties come with positive regional, intl. impact
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – Kazem Gharibabadi, Iran's Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs, says that good relations between Iran and Saudi Arabia will have positive regional and international consequences.

title: Russia to assess full-fledged atomic tests over Trump's words
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – The Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has stressed that the United States and European countries need to win Iran's trust by taking confidence-building measures.

title: Intercommunal clash kills at least 33 people in Chad
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – At least 33 people were killed in clash between herders and farmers in southwestern Chad, a local official and a traditional leader said on Wednesday.

title: Iran volleyball earn hard fought win over Bahrain in ISG
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – Iran’s men’s volleyball team defeated Bahrain 3-2 (25-21, 22-25, 25-16, 22-25, 15-7) at the 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games (ISG) on Wednesday.

title: Iran sympathizes with Indonesia, Philippines over fatal flood
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – The Iranian foreign ministry spokesman expressed his sympathy with the governments and people of the Philippines and Indonesia over the devastating storm and flooding in the two countries.

title: Iran Parl. Speaker Ghalibaf departs for Pakistan
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – Iranian Parliament Speaker Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf left Tehran for Islamabad on Wednesday to meet with high-ranking officials of this country.

title: Iran learns fate at AFC Futsal Asian Cup 2026
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 05 (MNA) – Iran was drawn in Group D of the AFC Futsal Asian Cup Indonesia 2026.

title: پایداری جو در کرمانشاه ادامه دارد؛ آسمان استان صاف تا قسمتی ابری
summary: کرمانشاه - مدیرکل هواشناسی استان کرمانشاه از تداوم شرایط پایدار جوی تا پایان هفته آینده خبر داد و گفت: هوای استان در این مدت صاف تا قسمتی ابری و در برخی ساعات با وزش باد همراه خواهد بود.

title: بیسیم چی‌ها پل ارتباطی میان فرماندهان و نیروهای خط مقدم بودند
summary: نوشهر - یک پیشکسوت و فرمانده دوران دفاع مقدس گفت: بی‌سیم‌چی‌ها همیشه گمنام بودند اما نقش آن‌ها در همه عملیات‌ها تعیین‌کننده و پل ارتباطی میان فرماندهان و نیروهای خط مقدم بودند.

title: اعلام اسامی داوران بخش معارف مسابقات سراسری قرآن کریم
summary: اسامی اعضای هیأت داوران مرحله نهایی بخش معارفی چهل و هشتمین دوره مسابقات سراسری قرآن از سوی مرکز امور قرآنی سازمان اوقاف و امور خیریه اعلام شد.

title: استراحت ۶ روزه ساپینتو برای استقلال
summary: تمرینات استقلال با توجه به برنامه بازی های تیم ملی برای ۶ روز تعطیل شد.

title: سرویس غیرمجاز دانش‌آموزی عامل تصادف گلستان؛ هشدار اتحادیه حمل و نقل
summary: مدیرعامل اتحادیه حمل و نقل مسافر شهری، تأکید کرد: تصادف دانش‌آموزان در گلستان ناشی از استفاده از سرویس غیرمجاز بوده و والدین تنها از ناوگان ثبت‌شده در سامانه «سپند» استفاده کنند.

title: وداع مردم گلستان با «صابرِ والیبال ایران»؛ صابر کاظمی در آغوش خاک
summary: آق قلا- مردم شهرستان آق‌قلا و جمعی از ورزش‌دوستان استان گلستان با حضور پرشور در مراسم تشییع زنده‌یاد صابر کاظمی، قهرمان ملی والیبال، با پیکر وی وداع کردند. ‌
